name: George D. FISH, Stephen Hrabrick and Jonathan A. Briskin, Respondents v. TOWNSHIP OF LOWER MERION, Petitioner
name_abbreviation: Fish v. Township of Lower Merion

parties: George D. FISH, Stephen Hrabrick and Jonathan A. Briskin, Respondents v. TOWNSHIP OF LOWER MERION, Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 8th day of April, 2015, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, as stated by petitioner, is:
(1) Did the Commonwealth Court err in deciding that the Lower Merion business privilege tax could not apply to a business receiving gross receipts from the business of leasing real estate?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
112 A.3d 1209
George D. FISH, Stephen Hrabrick and Jonathan A. Briskin, Respondents v. TOWNSHIP OF LOWER MERION, Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 8, 2015.
